questiontext.text: What is the difference between a ballistic missile and a cruise missile?

answer.text: A ballistic missile cannot be launched from a submarine
A ballistic missile is guided all the way to the target
A ballistic missile can deliver nuclear payload
A ballistic missile typically carries a smaller payload

questiontext.text: Why do warheads of long-range missiles have to be placed in re-entry vehicles?

answer.text: To protect them from the heat generated upon re-entry into atmosphere

questiontext.text: An aircraft without a human pilot aboard which is able to target and decoy, reconnaissance, combat is:
UAVs...

answer.text: can operate in high altitudes and out of line of sight

questiontext.text: What are main multilateral, politically-binding instruments devised to curb missile proliferation?

answer.text: The Hague Code of Conduct against Ballistic Missile Proliferation

questiontext.text: Choose the correct statements concerning Russia and NATO Ballistic Missile Defence (BMD)

answer.text: In the past, European countries discussed with Russia collaboration concerning NATO BMD
Russia uses opposition against BMD in Europe for domestic political purposes
Russia does not have means to counter missile defence capabilities in Europe
NATO BMD is a United States system provided to NATO countries

questiontext.text: The placement of nuclear weapons or other weapons of mass destruction in space is banned by:

answer.text: The Prevention of Arm Race in Outer Space (PAROS)

questiontext.text: An area demarcated by the lowest altitude above sea level at which objects can orbit the Earth (approximately 100km) is defined as:
Threats to outer space environment and assets include:
Space debris is:

answer.text: Accumulation of all objects in space which can harm/destroy satellite, bigger than 10 cm in diameter.
Collection of defunct man-made objects in space which can harm/destroy satellite.
Residue of man-made objects after it was destroyed by space weapon.
Residue of un-burnt propellant floating on orbit.

questiontext.text: The ability to detect, track, identify and catalogue objects in outer space (e.g. satellites, space debris, etc.), observe space weather, as well as monitor manoeuvers of spacecraft and payloads and other events is known as:
Elements of Missile Defense in Europe are stationed in:
Which states have overtly tested ground-based weapons designed to incapacitate or destroy satellites for strategic military purposes (so-called ASAT)?

answer.text: United States, Russia, China, India, France, DPRK

questiontext.text: The European Union...

answer.text: is a pro-active actor in international efforts to curb missile proliferation.
is not a proponent of voluntary multilateral arrangements that seek to limit the spread of missile technologies.
is participating in the development of ballistic missile defence (BMD) for Europe.
strongly believes that a Code of Conduct for Outer Space Activities is necessary to prevent an incident or conflict in space.

questiontext.text: International cooperation in peaceful uses of outer space, space research and dissemination of space-relevant information is coordinated and supervised by:

answer.text: United Nations Committee on the Peaceful Uses of Outer Space (UNCOPUOS)

questiontext.text: The Hague Code of Conduct against Ballistic Missile Proliferation is signed by:

answer.text: Only NATO member states, Russia and China
Only by states which are endowed with weapons of mass destruction and ballistic missiles

questiontext.text: An intercontinental ballistic missile is a...

answer.text: extremely accurate missile capable to fly at a very low altitude, thereby avoiding detection
guided ballistic missile with a minimum range of 5 500 km

questiontext.text: Ballistic missiles can be today launched from:
Choose the correct answers with regard to ballistic missiles and space launch vehicles

answer.text: Ballistic missiles usually have more accurate guidance systems than space launch vehicles
Space launch vehicles are used only for civilian purposes
Ballistic missiles cannot be converted into space launch vehicles

questiontext.text: How many members of the European Union signed up to the Hague Code of Conduct against Ballistic Missile Proliferation?
To detect, identify, track and destroy a ballistic missile, you need:
Most ballistic missile defense systems rely on:
The purpose of the NATO European Ballistic Missile Defence is to:

answer.text: Protect against Chinese and Russian ICBM attacks
Protect NATO European territory, people and forces

questiontext.text: The space domain today is:

answer.text: More congested with increasing number of space actors and growing amount of space debris
Contested due to the strategic nature of services it provides

questiontext.text: Current space arms control proposals:
Space Transparency and Confidence-Building Measures

answer.text: Are important policy tools that promote norms of responsible behavior for space activities
Are included in various initiatives, included in the EU proposal for an International Space Code of Conduct

questiontext.text: The EU is active in the following voluntary instruments designed to control missile proliferation:

answer.text: The Hague Code of Conduct for Ballistic Missile Proliferation

questiontext.text: Missile defence development in Europe:

answer.text: Is based on bilateral agreements between the U.S. and Russia

questiontext.text: The basic themes that permeate space security include:

answer.text: Secure access to, and use of, space
Security on Earth from threats emanating from space
